column2: CONNECTICUT PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column6: CT

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. When you see a no passing zone sign:
column6: you may not pass cars ahead of you in your lane.
column8: you must pull off the road and come to a complete stop.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column6: Steep downgrade

column2: 3. This sign warns ____________ ahead.
column6: of two-way traffic

column2: 4. What do pennant-shaped signs indicate?
column6: A No Passing Zone

column2: 5. Which statement about drinking alcohol and driving is true?
column4: After drinking, a cold shower will sober you up.
column6: Alcohol affects judgement and coordination, which are needed to drive safely.
column8: If you are under the legal BAC limit, your driving is not affected.

column2: 6. A flashing red light means:
column4: The light will soon change to steady red.
column6: The same as a STOP sign.

column2: 7. A steady green light at intersections means:
column6: You may drive through the intersection if the road is clear

column2: 8. The yield sign means:
column4: Drive with caution in wet weather.
column6: Slow down and give vehicles crossing your path the right-of-way.
column8: You must come to a complete stop.

column2: 9. Give the right-of-way to any pedestrian:
column4: if you have the green light.
column6: on the opposite side of the street.

column2: 10. Which statement about driving and drugs is true?
column4: Prescription drugs are safe to use if they don't make you feel drowsy.
column6: Only illegals drugs can impair your driving.
column8: Even over the counter drugs can impair your driving.

column2: 11. When driving in fog, you should never use your high beams because:
column4: oncoming vehicles might not see you.
column6: vehicles behind you may follow too closely.
column8: the light will reflect back into your eyes.

column2: 12. When approaching an intersection with a traffic control signal that is not working, drivers should:
column4: speed up and proceed through the intersection.
column6: try not to stop if the intersection is clear.
column8: stop as you would if there were stop signs in all directions, yield the right-of-way, then enter the intersection.

column2: 13. The first sign drivers see when approaching a highway-rail intersection is usually:
column6: an advance warning sign.

column2: 14. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.
column6: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.
column8: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.

column2: 15. A red traffic sign means?
column6: Railroad crossing.

column2: 16. This road sign means:
column6: Playground ahead

column2: 17. The amount of alcohol in the blood is measured by:
column6: blood alcohol concentration (BAC).

column2: 18. Parking is not allowed:
column4: in an intersection, unless permitted by signs.
column6: on public roads
column8: within 300 feet of a pedestrian safety area.

column2: 19. This road sign means:
column6: Two-way traffic ahead

column2: 20. Excessive speed:
column4: saves time so you can get to your destination more quickly.
column6: increases the likelihood of serious bodily injuries and death.
column8: helps you to maneuver around obstacles.

column2: 21. If you are blinded by headlights on an approaching vehicle, you should:
column4: move your eyes to the right.
column6: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.

column2: 22. Following another vehicle too closely is known as:
column6: closetailing.

column2: 23. This sign means:
column6: Parking is not allowed.

column2: 24. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column4: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.
column6: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.
column8: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.

column2: 25. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column6: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.
column8: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.
